runs.comm: it's a day for wides. Tanvir sends the first one two feet down the leg side.
shot, Vusi. Back of a length outside off, angling across. No lateral movement. Vusi stands up with the bounce and crunches the square-drive through cover-point.
back of a length again from Tanvir, and he extracts some lift too. Sibanda drops it into the covers as he hops back.
another wide. This time outside off. I declare today World Wide Day.
and another. Slightly harsh call as the batsman tried to steer through the off side, and it wasn't far from the edge.
Chamu gets beside the line this time and pushes it into the covers.
whoa. Chamu taps off the back foot straight to Malik running in from short extra cover and they think of a fanciful single. Hamilton turned back at the very last moment and dived in.
this time they go for the suicidal single, and Malik misses the stumps from five yards away. Chamu dives in, but that wouldn't have helped if the under-armed throw hit.
Sibanda softly drops a short of length ball towards point for a single.
good length ball to start off, and Vusi scoops it in the air almost straight to the man at cover.
Malik's electric at cover. He hauls himself to his right this time to parry a well-timed extra-cover drive
Chibhabha gets cramped on the crease as a length ball nips in, and they get a single to the off side.

Misbah, you stunning jack in the box. The old man still has plenty of steam. Sibanda tries to get under a length ball and thump it straight, and seemed to have done enough to clear mid-on. Someone forgot to tell Misbah that he had no business running back, leaping away towards the boundary and pouching it with both hands as it came down over his shoulder. What. A. Catch.
Sohail keeps it on a length to Chamu, who drives down the ground.

if you had blinked you would have missed Zhuwao's innings. Short of a length from Sohail, landed on middle and angled away ever so slightly across the left-hander. Zhuwao didn't move the feet as he got squared up, he just hung his bat at it, and ended up feathering it into the keeper's gloves.
Chamu drives nicely, but picks out the fielder in the covers.
straighter ball this time, and Chamu works it to the leg side. The placement is still not there.
width from Tanvir, too short and too wide outside off, Chamu upper cuts it backward of point for a couple.
another couple, this time in front of square as Tanvir provides room once again.
Chamu stays back in the crease and opens the face to guide a short of length ball towards third man for one.
shuffles across to off stump first ball, and works a length ball towards square leg. Would have been in trouble if he had not got bat on that.
Sohail gets some sharp inward movement and Taylor does well to spot the line and drive.
short ball, too short and Chibhabha gets under it. Called a wide.
offcutter from Sohail, Chamu walks into it and dabs a single towards point. Zimbabwe are falling behind very fast here.
keeps it on a length to Taylor, who is looking to get forward and defends down the track

stunning shot from Taylor, but the man in the stands at deep midwicket has just put down a 100 USD. That's what you get for holding catches in the crowd today. He grins sheepishly now, but no shame really - his countrymen on the field have also been abject. What a good shot though. In the slot, Taylor walks into line and whacks it across with a short-arm jab.
pushes the single this time, into the off side.
this one jars in towards the pads, and Chamu looks to lap it away. It goess of the pad to short fine leg.
short and reasonably pacy from Tanvir, Chamu forces it without timing towards midwicket for one.
Malik does all he can to get a run out, but it ain't happening. Taylor taps a ball straight at him in the covers and they scurry across. Taylor comes between Malik's throw and the stumps.
finally some momentum. Chamu gets hold of a length offering now and lofts it high over long-on. Scooped it higher than he wanted, and gets 4 instead of 6 for it.
back of a length again, and angling across. Chamu steers a single through to third man.
another one bites the dust. Taylor walks across as always and times the hoisted whip particularly well. In hindsight, too well. The shot ended in Yasir Shah's hands at deep backward square leg.
Chamu again opens the face and guides with Tanvir's angle down to third man for one.
Chamu welcomes Cheema with a crisp little upper cut over point. Width on this track is not a very good idea.
short of a length outside off, and more importantly, cutting the room. Chamu taps through point for a single.
short of a length outside off, Hamilton is away with a steered single through point.
full length on Chamu's pads, and he bottom hands a single to mid-on.
on the pads, Hamilton whips furiously to deep square leg for one.
Chamu walks across his stumps, Cheema angles it in and gets away with what might have been a wide down the leg side.
short ball to start off, but no room. Hamilton hacks it into the covers without timing for one.
closer to the off stump and cut away once again.
fuller length, draws Hamilton forward into a check-drive.
sloppy from Sohail Khan at deep point. Runs across languidly and waves Hamilton's cut along to the fence.
Hamilton goes leg side this time, a laboured drag-flick for a couple more.
short lengths from Yasir through that over, another single punches into the wide mid-off area.
Cheema cuts the room this time and angles it onto the hips, Hamilton works it for a single towards midwicket.
slower ball on leg stump, Chamu clips it off the toes through square leg and hustles back for two.
nippy bouncer from Cheema, a very resourceful dot-ball option. Chamu ducks under it.
shapes this into the pads, but there are men patrolling the deep to ensure he gets only a single.
overdoes the cramping this time, and ends up giving a wide down the leg side.
holds the length back, and Hamilton chops into the covers for a single.
slower ball comes off the back of the hand, and Chamu mistimes his forcing pull. A single to long-on nevertheless.
nice line to end the over, not much Hamilton can do with it. Dribbles into the leg side without timing.
flat on middle and off, worked with the angle to the leg side for one.
Hamilton chips out and drives with the turn through mid-on.
Hafeez slows it up in the air as Hamilton advances and he plays all over it, but keeps it out.

and gone. The pressure gets to Hamilton. It was a back of length ball from Hafeez, his typical asphixiating length that can't be driven. Hamilton tried to rock back and cross-bat it, but it wasn't short enough for that either. He ends up spooning it straight up and the man at midwicket settles under it.

Hafeez is in a hat-trick. What more can he do this year? May be win the Nobel Prize? Back of a length, nothing ball that skidded along amiably towards Chamu who turned the wrists a touch too early and was struck on the back foot in front of middle.
hat-trick ball is over-pitched on the toes and Coventry clips it through square leg for a single. This game is meandering towards a dull finish. One-sided T20s can get quite aggravating ...
Coventry tries to reverse-sweep Yasir with the spin, but can't get much on it. Single to short third man.
short ball on middle and breaking away, Elton hacks away into the covers.
on Coventry's pads and he politely works it through midwicket for two.
looks to slog sweep the leggie against the turn from wide outside off. It turns away and takes the top edge to go wide of the keeper.
nearly a six, in fact the umpire thinks it is six. Supremely well struck that, it was full and on the pads, he goes down on a knee and slugs it over the head of deep midwicket.
flattens the length, on middle stump and Coventry hangs back to push a single to mid-on.
Hafeez plugs away on the pads, another nurdle through the leg side. Only a single.

the case for the Nobel Prize becomes stronger. Hafeez picks up another wicket, but honestly, all credit for that wicket goes to Sohail Tanvir. It was full on leg stump, Elton went down on a knee and looked to lash the sweep high and square. Tanvir moved quickly to his right and took it one handed as he dived away to his right.
back of a length on middle and off, he stays back in the crease and plays it into the off side.
Taibu is away with a nervy single, he pushes straight to mid-on and takes off, but the fumble helps him.
boy, Coventry is hitting them sweetly today. Hafeez angles another one into the pads, and Coventry wrists the heave all the way over midwicket. Whiplash.
full ball on leg stump, Taibu sweeps to deep square leg for two.
looks to sweep again, from wide of off stump and it is outside edged towards third man.
Coventry sure looks the part today. He reverse slaps a legbreak over the short third man fieldsman and the ball scurries away for four more.
full-pitched on middle and leg, swept away through square leg for one.
googly from Yasir, it is too short though and allows Taibu to rock back and pull.
Coventry holds the key here. He lines up a tossed up ball on off stump and thumps it straight down the ground for four more. Some uppity in that shot.
tossed up on middle and leg, Taibu quietly takes the straight single and turns it over.
Can Conventry be stopped? Just good clean hitting here. Ajmal tosses this up outside off, slow and drifty, looking for the mis-hit, but Coventry waits and slams it over midwicket for four.

ah, the honeymoon's over. Ajmal's wiles, as always (except when the batsman is Hussey), come to the fore. Fastish, loopy, speared on the stumps, Coventry top-edges the slog heave and it pops up between the keeper running back and short third man. They run into each other, but one of them has completed the catch by then.
turning into the sweep for Taibu to sweep for a single.
Price hangs back in the crease in an attempt to read the doosra and blocks to the off side.
looks to sweep and plays it onto the boot. It goes to the off side and they get the single.

Zim have tried their best to give a wicket to a run out today. They have ultimately succeeded, and it is that man, Prof. Hafeez, once again. Price dabs listlessly in front of point and takes off equally listlessly. Taibu never had a chance. Hafeez charged in, picked up and swung down the stumps from point-blank range.
full-pitched on off and middle, pushed straight down the ground for one.

I don't think I have ever seen Pakistan field this well. Yasir Shah has taken a dream catch running in from long on. Jarvis tried to nail this length ball from Cheema down the ground but looped it up in the air. Yasir bolted in, dived forward and was at full stretch, and almost on the roll as he took that catch inches above the grass. He seemed to have dived too early and was on the descent when he reached the ball, with his hands under him rather than in front. What a take!
Cheema pushes this one too far down the leg side for a wide.
over-pitched on off stump, driven through mid-off for a single.
on the pads, worked through square leg for a single.
full ball on off stump to end the over, driven down the ground for a single.
flat on the pads, whipped through square leg for one.
Hilarious! Umar Akmal appeals for a catch behind as Price reverse sweeps and misses. An impatient Ajmal turns umpire, says not out and gestures for the ball!
fired in on the pads, Price is late on the shot and it dribbles away off the pads to the leg side.
gets behind the line this time and plays it back to the bowler.
he finally gets the reverse sweep right, past short third man for a single.
Hafeez keeps it full on leg stump, Price swings it away without making good contact to the leg side.

Hafeez has four wickets to go with his 71. He is Man of the Match, and just give him the Nobel Prize now. Sharp, flat, straight, you-miss-I-hit stuff. Price slogs across the line and misses, the middle stump falls back. Hafeez follows up his career-best batting effort with his best figures in this format.
